DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the potential interactions between intravenous methamphetamine and oral selegiline.
DOC.brief_title: Assessment of Potential Interactions Between Methamphetamine and Selegiline - 1
DOC.detailed_description: To determine the safety of the selegiline concurrent with d-methamphetamine challenges of 15mg & 30mg i.v. with the focus being on cardiovascular responses (HR,BP) to the i.v. methamphetamine challenges. This is a randomized, single-blind, placebo-controlled, two-arm study design to evaluate the safety of selegiline treatment, compared to placebo treatment, concurrent with i.v. methamphetamine challenges.
DOC.criteria: Volunteers who meet DSM4 criteria for methamphetamine abuse or dependence; nontreatment seeking individuals Be able to verbalize understanding of consent form; provide written informed consent Please contact site for more information
